intro: Scariola leucoclada, commonly known as the white-flowered scariola, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, aromatic scent, while its flowers appear in clusters at the ends of the stems. Scariola leucoclada is often found in dry, open habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
